translations.errToTooBig: too many stitches to add - {$PH} can grow to {$PH_1} max
translations.errToTooSmall: too few stitches to keep - {$PH} can shrink to {$PH_1} min
translations.help1: Enter both the number of stitches on your current row ({$START_BOLD_TEXT}From:{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT}) and the desired number of stitches on your next row ({$START_BOLD_TEXT}To:{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT}).
translations.help2: The result will be shown immediately and consist of instructions to {$START_ITALIC_TEXT}keep{$CLOSE_ITALIC_TEXT} stitches ({$START_BOLD_TEXT}K{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT}), {$START_ITALIC_TEXT}add{$CLOSE_ITALIC_TEXT} extra stitches ({$START_BOLD_TEXT}A{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT}) or {$START_ITALIC_TEXT}combine{$CLOSE_ITALIC_TEXT} two stitches into one ({$START_BOLD_TEXT}C{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT}).
translations.help3: The number after a letter is the number of repetitions, eg. {$START_BOLD_TEXT}A2{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT} means {$START_ITALIC_TEXT}add two extra stitches{$CLOSE_ITALIC_TEXT}.
translations.help4: Global repetitions ({$START_BOLD_TEXT}2x ( {$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT}…{$START_BOLD_TEXT} ){$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT}) instruct you to repeat all stitches inside the parentheses the given number of times, eg. {$START_BOLD_TEXT}3x ( K1 A1 ){$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT} is a shorter version of {$START_BOLD_TEXT}K1 A1 K1 A1 K1 A1{$CLOSE_BOLD_TEXT}.
